For viral infections, it is generally recommended to rest and avoid strenuous activities, stay hydrated by drinking plenty of fluids, and use over-the-counter medications such as acetaminophen or ibuprofen to reduce fever and alleviate symptoms. (1)

Acetaminophen is often considered a first-line treatment for viral infections due to its analgesic and antipyretic effects. (2) However, it is essential to note that taking high doses of acetaminophen can lead to liver damage.

For more severe cases or complications, such as pneumonia or bronchitis, antibiotics may be prescribed by a healthcare provider, especially if the infection is caused by a bacteria like influenza or COVID-19. (3)

It is also recommended to practice good hygiene, including washing hands frequently with soap and water, and avoiding close contact with others to prevent the spread of the infection. (4)

As for my initial skepticism, I recall reading an academic paper by Dr. Yoshiki Mori et al., published in 2012, where they demonstrated the jellyfish's ability to transdifferentiate its cells and transform back into its polyp stage.
